caption: Great, they were open late, they a whole bunch of sandwiches for us, we had a huge order, very well done by the staff
Cook messed up my order. The sandwich was Nasty!
Daughter and I were walking by and decided on stopping.I'm glad we did.Really enjoyed our cheese steaks.
Gld they have the halal menu now, the pizza steak is amazing
Corner deli has better cheesesteak than them. So disappointing 😞

It was saddening to know we drove from long island to brooklyn for disappointment. The sandwiches were mediocre at best. There was no flavor at all and he meat was simply steamed on the grill. The bacon cheese fries had burnt crumbs of bacon and the steak fries simply had large peices of the unflavored beef thrown on top of fries and cheese. Our stomachs didn't agree with the food later that night.
I enjoy the Philly steak and cheese and fries.
Super friendly staff. Very clean. Food was super good. Highly recommend. Hits that Philly cheesesteak craving perfectly.
Food is so good I’m happy with my experience coming here and would love to eat here more ‼️
BEST CHEESESTEAK IN BROOKLYN!!!!
Not as good as it once was...
Good sandwiches and good service. 👍🏼
Love their seasoned French fries

I had a great experience with this restaurant! We ordered our food just as we were leaving Manhattan, when we arrived everything was fresh and hot and the staff were very friendly and helpful! The food was tasty and the bread was really good!
The chef made my sandwich just right and Ali answered all my questions and was extremely patient with me. :)
Bacon cheese fries and Philly cheese stake sandwiches were on point. Best of all, its halal 👌
Fast, simple, and the place was real clean.

I received stellar service from this location.  Ali was patient with me as I combed the menu.  He assured me the time I took was no problem while joking and making me feel very welcome.  His customer service was very accommodating and a breath of fresh air.  Carlos is clearly a master behind the grill because my sandwich was absolutely delish.  I asked Carlos to make my sandwich with love; and he did just that!  Kudos to this location for having these guys on the team!  They clearly get customer service 101!   I will definitely be back!
Nice and respectful employees treated with such kindness fresh food
Good food and good employees the cook take great pride on been clean and giving great food service to guess good job
Nice food and awesome staff! They were very kind.

(Translated by Google) The best place in Brooklyn to eat sandwiches the employees are friendly fast and have good customer service MY DOMINICANS PLEASE THROUGH WHOM TO EAT I RECOMMEND YOU 🥳🥳🥳🥳🥳🥳🥳🥳🥳🥳  (Original) El mejor lugar de Brooklyn para comer sándwich los empleados son amables rápidos y tienen buena atención con el cliente MIS DOMINICANOS PASEN POR A QUI A COMER SE LOS RECOMIENDO 🥳🥳🥳🥳🥳🥳🥳🥳🥳🥳

Couldn't wait to eat here due to friends raving about the steak sandwich. It was ok nothing to jump through hoops about. Onion rings very oily, fries were good. I'll give it another try see if my opinion changes but for now just ok
Better than expected

A Philly original, proud to have Tony Lukes in Brooklyn at the heart of the economic and social revitalization in the core of Brooklyn regentrification. I ordered in-store for takeout. Unbelievably fast and friendly.
Best halal philly cheese steaks in NYC
Very good. Everything was fresh and made for you. Service was awesome!
Love the cheese steak!
Hire new staff that actually wants to work not play behind the counter I would have loved to try the Philly cheesesteak sandwich but ill wait till i go to Philadelphia.
Great food good location staff is great for the most part
My wife just love the heroes.  Very popular in my book.

I ordered wings and was so disappointed because they were terrible.  Chicken sandwich was 5/10 and famous philly was 4/10, we were missing a flavor in it. Had no extra hot sauce or white sauce with the sandwiches. The saice they gave with the wings tasted like a regular hotsauce topped with some cilantro.. not a good experience. Will not come back to eat from here.
Terrible service and overpriced foods decent but not worth the amount of money I wasted
Definitely was a great sandwich and as well as the service, would definitely come back again. 👍

I placed an order via seamless.  The order took forever so we canceled delivery and picked it up.  It was all wrong and they refused to fix it or let me speak with a manager.  Never again.  They said I ordered it wrong, charge me more I was clear what I wanted,  my husbands order was correctly entered but is was 100% wrong.  My daughter we paid extra for mushrooms no mushrooms.  Been waiting 10 min. With no response to speaking to supervisor.

Not the same place I'm used to. The day they stopped carrying pork I decided not to go back. Basically a fast food cheesesteak for truck drivers now. It's on Pat's and Gino's was always better. Tony Luke just paid for publicity and cashed out when the time was right.

I wish there was a zero stars option. God awful. I felt bad giving some of it to my dog before I threw it away. Worst cheese steak I've ever had by far. Dark brown solid mass of "wiz" for the fries. Milkshake made of grey concrete. Don't waste your money.
They're cheese steak sandwiches are the best in Brooklyn love it

Not sure why this joint is only 3.9 stars, this place is pretty great. The lady at the register today was nice, and the portion of meat you get for the $8 junior cheesesteak seemed pretty good. The onion rings and petal sauce was also great- neither the rings or the sandwich was overly greasy. I'll be coming here more often! (Tip: Don't get cheese wiz on the sandwich though. I tried it out after hearing about "wizwit," it's not that good. Just get provolone.)
Absolutely delicious !! As close as it gets to roadtripping  to philly
Great Chessesteak Sandwich 🥪🥪🥪
Curly fries are the bomb! Best post thanksgiving dinner ever haha
Delicious!

OMG!!!! From the moment I entered this business, the woman who took my order was so rude!!! She had an attitude that was so bad I lost my appetite. As in the fact that the sandwich was so small, I definitely did not see any value in patronizing this business. I asked for a refund as I could not stay there any longer and I was told I’d have to come back on Wednesday when the owner was there. I have to wait five days for a refund? A testament to the experience there. Never again!!!
For the price, the sandwich was very bland. The fries however were on point.

On behalf of all philly Natives  living in NYC...PLEASE  CHOP UP YOUR STEAK. Steak was nearly whole .. ... Import Amoroso’s Rolls from philly  and give people a full on 12 inch sandwich . Too small for the price .   Still haven’t found a place that’s  gotten in right In NYC , been living here for 10 years. definitely not the same as Tony Luke’s in 30 st station in philly . Still better then the other ones I’ve have in NYC. But come on, don’t claim authentic if y’all skimping in the meat , bread and condiments . Be well.

100% Halal is why I was happy to stop by. The setup is cute, the food is cooked in front of you as well. We ordered the Philly cheesesteak, lady liberty & the Cheesesteak hoagie but I think our order was messed up. The food was a bit on the salty and greasy side but still tasted good. The presentation was a bit messy. The customer service was fast and easy.
Best Cheesesteak in BK
This time when i visited this location i was slightly disappointed because I found out that they took the pork sandwich off the menu the sandwich was still good i just prefer the pork
Delicious food!  Note: DO NOT USE GRUBHUB to order, they will charge an extra $5 per sandwich, simply call the restaurant directly and order!

Very slow service. I only ordered 2 orders of fries and they took like 20 minutes. Cashier not wearing mask, cook not wearing hair net.
Best place to eat in NEW YORK
Food is wonderful, but cook is slow,so have patience, its worth it .
Amazing, the food and the services. The lady that took my order and the chef was very respectful and polite. Everything was AMAZING.

Hello folks welcome all new people new eye 👀 balls and new beeeeeeeeeeeeeeez thanks for reading my post okay this restaurant here has some great tasting sandwiches very fresh and made to very mouth watering and will make your stomach happy various items to choose from me i can eat the store every thing in here taste good prices are fair very clean fun staff here as well to and so on so if you are near here stop in and eat well I recommend any one here until the next time peace
Nice tht they are open late ,food is pretty good too
Great place
Pricey and got my order wrong...

Just ate here today, and while the food itself was fine (it's exactly what you expect when you eat a cheese steak). The staff was nice and food seemed to come out as quickly as they could make it.  The reason I'm giving them 3 stars is that the place is gross. Everything is greasy. Literally puddles by the fryer and a fine mist coating everywhere else. Maybe their ventillation system needs work or they need a new porter.  The staff don't wear their facemasks either. I'm not usually super bothered by that... but it was every single employee. Just thought the owner/manager should know so they don't get shut down by DOHMH.
good taste and attention
Amazing halal cheesesteaks
Delicious Philly Cheese steak sandwich
Way too salty.
Tony needs to come look at his location it looks dirty and a stomach virus waiting to happen. Nothing like the ones out of town..
The bread is so warm and fresh it's so yummy
Was not good...
Was ok but nothing special

At first I was excited to come here but it quickly turned to uncertainty. I ordered but then noticed the girl ringing the order was not wearing a mask nor gloves AND she was chomping on food like it was her last meal on death row. By the time I realized it I already ordered. I was too busy making sure I maintained my 6 feet distance which was impossible to do with 4 other people coming in behind me to pick up orders for Uber etc. Well I ordered which was quick but then had to wait because the guy behind the grill took a break to let his kid and baby mother in behind the counter and to some back room. When he came out he began our order. After that the kid came back out the room to the cooking area and asked his dad for something so pops had to go back there and tend to whatever the nugget wanted. Apparently he left for too long  because then I watched gloveless-maskless cashier girl step to the grill and man what pops left behind including my curly fries which came out overly cooked and hard. I can tell she was trying not to man the grill but finally gave in after 5 min of no sign of pops, the fry machine ringing, and meat cooking on the flat top. I owe pops a thanks for them most brutally crunchy curly fries. The food was sooo good don't get me wrong but the professionalism is missing. I think I'd wait to Philly for the original just off customer service alone.
Very slow. Only 2 people in line took 22 minutes for them to make my philly cheese steak. I won't be going back. If they don't improve their time they will be out of business.
FRESH FOOD,PROFESSIONAL&COURTEST. REAL DEAL!!!

Delivery took almost 2 hours to arrive so the food came cold and the smoothies were watered down and warm. After taking so long they didn’t even deliver it to my door. Definitely shouldn’t take that long considering I’m about 3 blocks down from the place. Really disappointing because this was my first time ordering from here and I was really excited.
The cook was lousy and the philly cheese was undercooked point blank overrated garbage never again fake cheesesteak
Slacked on the fries,cheese tasted old. Gave 1 serving of fries for three people
it was good best thing next to Phillys sandwich
Really good food

If you’re craving a Philly cheesesteak from philly, this will definitely hit the spot. Ordered take out on a Saturday night, food arrived on time and was fresh and hot! I got the traditional one, wit onions and cheese wiz with a side of cheese curly fries (cheese comes on the side). Will order from here again!
This PLACE SUCKS. Food is disgusting
I'm in B..K.. Visiting fam figured I would swing by & give it a try... WoW... This has to be one of the top 3 sandwiches I have ever had.. No  b.s...

The girl who took my order was in such a bad mood. Ugh. Horrible customer service. I paid extra for lettuce/tomatoes and guess what, No Lettuce/Tomatoes! Told the miserable girl, No Onions! But there were onions! Sandwich was good, but it would be nice to get what I ordered.
Wasn't worth the money. Meat has no taste at at. Thinking they might be using steakums & just chopping it up🤔 But at least u get alot of meat. Just take it home & spruce it up urself 😁

Worst cheesesteak i have had in my life. Overpriced, meat and onions not chopped up and an entire jar of mayo put on bread. Flavorless!!! The 1 star is for pickles on the side that were tasty. Cheese fries with old bacon  but they used cheesewiz and it was saltier than the dead sea. $40 for 2 cheese steak sandwiches, 1 cheese/bacon fries, 1 plain fries, a watery shake and a soda. Never again mate.
Not bad on the fly
The philly cheesesteak was on point. However my bacon cheese fries were so salty, i couldn't eat them

Went in there last night none of the staff were wearing mask . One guy  was eating another person was drinking and the other person was on the phone . With COVID-19 and everything going on I thought they would be more careful. I walked out This  just isn’t  acceptable maybe the boss man wasn’t around . When the cats away the mice will play .
DELICIOUS...TIMELY WILL DEFINITELY ORDER AGAIN

Finally came out to Brooklyn to try this out and man was it really good! Felt like I was in philly eating a cheesesteak the wiz was good and the beef was fresh just the perfect amount of onions and the cheese fries were cooked perfectly and delicious cant wait to go back to this location or when they finally open up in Queens and Long Island!

Im korean and on my order slip instead of asking me my name, the cashier wrote 'chino' which is spanish for 'china man'. At a time when our nation is dealing with racial tension and inequity, this is a VERY unwise thing for an employee to do. The publicity alone should lower their business sales. I am going to make sure everyone knows what happened and not to go to Tony Lukes anymore.
I ordered online for takeout. The food was ready at the exact time they said it would be. It’s hot and delicious! Staff is always cool there

My first time ordering a from this place. The employee who was making my sandwich never changed his gloves.First he was scratching his skin with the gloves he had on then he went to answer the phone with the same gloves and back went back into the kitchen to make my sandwich without changing the gloves. I would never ordered from here again. It was kind of them to refund me my money!
By far the best cheesesteak in Philly!

I order from here about once a week since they opened. Their food is always fresh, everyone is always friendly. I see some of the other reviews about forgetting items, this happened to me once but I called- the owner seemed more upset about it than me. He refunded me obviously, and next time I ordered he put what they forgot in the bag and didn’t even charge. Love having this play nearby

Ordered on  line to pick up and everything was ready at the time they said it would be. The food as delicious as it is at  the restaurant in south Philadelphia .I will still go down to  the south Philadelphia one as I don't mind the trip
This was a random late night find, and it was delicious.  The cheesesteaks are phenomenal and the fries are plentiful and delicious. We will definitely go here again.
Excellent sandwiches!! Fast and courteous delivery. My new go-to
Really Good Cheesesteaks in Brooklyn by far..
AWESOME
Horrible

Look, here the thing, this place is no Geno's. Either you understand what that means and I'm telling you something you knew long before reading this review, or you have no idea what I'm talking about and then it doesn't matter because you won't know what your missing anyway.  I gave this 5 starts because it it without a doubt the best cheesesteak your going to find IN NYC, so it has to get 5 stars.  Now for the actual review: the staff could with out a doubt be more friendly and professionally trained, but that will hopefully come in time  The cheesesteak its self is above avg but not great. Again, it's the best your going to find in the city. The bread is soft and fresh, and the steak is cut correctly, could use some more seasoning though.  The cheese its self is the biggest miss. I have been a coupe times and the cheese has not been that almost liquid consistency that your used to from a Philly steak, it's more of a think, almost mayo like consistency.  Short answer: if your craving a Philly and have the time, it's worth the trip. If you just kinf of want one, shorties or that cheesesteak truck that roams the city is all you need.

Excellent boneless chicken wings along with there ranch sauce,the boneless chicken all white meat seasoned just right. And there blue cheese sauce, also the have one of the best philly cheeses steaks sandwiches I ever tasted. The bread nice and soft and there steak melts in your mouth.  The cheese melted just right.the bread made soft with a little toasted crunch.  Hands down tony Luke's has to be in my top 3 of philly cheeses steak restaurants in NYC. Right in Brooklyn. They also make make some really good potato cheese wedges.  This is not a very big restaurant, but this place packs a big punch with it food .definitely a true nyc philly cheeses steak sandwich spot.
Awesome fries

When I was in Philadelphia this was the go to place for a Philly cheese steak sandwich. I was really surprised when I saw a Tony Luke's in Brooklyn so I had to try this place out to see if it lived up to the one in Philadelphia. It's very good an authentic tasting Philly cheese steak in New York City. Its not the largest place and there are no chairs (see pictures). But if you want a really good cheese steak this is the place to go. They recently added chairs (see pictures) So now you can sit.

The real deal Philly cheese steaks here in Brooklyn, finally. No one’s got it right until now. Fantastic egg, cheese, and bacon sandwich’s in the morning too. Who knew? They bake the bacon strips in the oven rather than grill. Killer!

Finally, a great Philly Cheesesteak in NY. These guys not only have the best, but are good peoples! I messed up my own order choosing pick-up instead of delivery. During this most recent order and after a little waiting and wondering, since their orders in the past have arrived waaaaay ahead of the scheduled time, I called them and found out my mistake. The gentleman I spoke to looked into it, informed me of the issues and immediately changed it to delivery, located a driver and sent A BRAND NEW SANDWICH on it's way to me! This will be my go-to for Cheesesteaks in NYC. Hands down! Thank you guys, and thank you to the man I spoke with, even more!
Yuck
Convenient/clean spot. Food was good, fries super salty so tell them to ease up if u not into high blood pressure lol. Definitely recommend.
In and out, ordered 3 cheesesteaks can't get any better than that
Literally the best cheesesteak sandwich I’ve had in a min !!! I RECOMMEND!! Especially the steak with American cheese, peppers and onions.
I love the bread it was very soft and tasty, but however the steak was very dry and it needed some seasoning on it.
Best fast food option in area. Hits the spot.
The chicken steak with onions and peppers was to die for. I had onion rings and a strawberry banana smoothie. Not a cheap place but sure is worth every dime.

I'm so happy I found this place. I'll have to make up excuses to go downtown now so I can get more!! I'm from Philly and this tastes like home! I got a buffalo chicken cheesesteak with fried onions pickles salt and pepper, and extra cheese... The only drawback was that the chicken wasn't really chopped properly... There were big pieces, but it was still really good... The chicken was juicy and tender!
Is this place a joke? Four employees behind the counter should be able to produce more than one sandwich in twenty minutes. Especially when there are only a couple customers in the place.
You must visit. The sandwiches are delicious
The pork sandwich is horrid!

Horrible. Just horrible.  My sandwich was cold in places and the bread was wet and was falling apart. I ordered the Italian pork sandwich and the pork was flavorless and tasted as if it was 4-5 days old.  I’m usually not a picky eater but I took 3 bites and couldn’t bear anymore. I was forced to throw the rest away.

Great food quality and very good food but no bathroom and the staff are like a high school cafeteria. Altough the staff was very nice while interacting with while sitting down eating they were cursing and singing along loudly to the music they were playing. Very unprofessional sorry to say cause they were nice. Best to take this food to go because the seats are very uncomfortable. The sandwich was very good. Food gets 5 stars but the duning area could be better.
Loved the cheese steaks and good service
Taste good but check ur food order was wrong twice when I went but good taste

Cheese steaks were great.  We got two combos and my son really wanted a bottled drink (combo comes with a fountain drink) and she was nice enough let us have the bottled drink.  Fries are ok. Two combos cost ab 20$and it was a little too much for us. My son Is 7...we probably could have shared one. They were made fast and fresh.    Good experience in general.
Was a really good sandwich fresh, awesome and juicy.
Cheesesteaks didn't live up to the hype, nice place though

While this cheese steak was perfectly middle ground ok, the experience really made our dining experience uncomfortable enough that we won't be returning.  The man who took our order (November 2 at 4:45) was difficult to deal with, and had an extremely hard time when I asked if I could order the pizza steak with chicken instead of steak, so I was like forget it, and ordered something else.  My boyfriend ordered his food, and then we sat down at the counters which were full of crumbs and pieces of napkins and generally dirty, to wait for our food.  We were on our way somewhere else so we had to eat there, so while we were eating, the man who took our order started screaming at another employee, because she apparently accidentally made an extra milkshake.  He continued to loudly berate her for a few minutes despite the fact that we were not the only customers in the open concept restaurant, and at one point shouted at her that she had to pay for it out of her paycheck.  Moments later he came over to my boyfriend and I and handed us a milkshake and said there was an extra made, and did we want it?  I asked "did that employee have to pay for it?" and he insisted she did not, and dropped it on the counter next to us. I am a person who has, and does work in the food service industry and the whole scenario made me so uncomfortable, that under the guise of needing more ketchup, I went to the pickup counter and asked another female employee if the milkshake was paid for by the girl that the man was shouting at, and she said it wasn't. I told her it made me uncomfortable, and I would pay for it so the girl didn't have to.  She said it was ok, and had been worked out, but as we left, the girl made eye contact with me through the window and mouthed "thank you" so I am glad I went out of my way to make a point of asking the man and the woman about it.  I hope the girl didn't have to pay for it, and I also am going to find a way to send this to corporate, because that man's attitude lost a native PA girl's business who was looking for a local spot with a taste of home.
Pretty bad service. Staff arguing. Sandwich was nothing special.
The philly cheesesteak sandwich or the chicken hoagie was nothing special you could find the same taste or better at a local deli.
Delicious food on par with Philly.
Found what looked like hard cartilage in both the chicken and beef steak sandwiches. The taste was okay.
Great sandwiches
Reasonably priced Philly  Cheesesteaks for this area.

I frequent this restaurant a lot and that dark skin girl with the big natural hair attracts my attention all the time. I think I’ve heard them call her “Bri.”  She moves extremely fast and is always jumping around to help the team. I’ve witnessed her work the fryer, give out multiple drinks, run to take an order, put a delivery order in, wrap sandwiches and back to her position. She also makes jokes with the delivery guys even though the restaurant is extremely busy. Anyone who can still smile under intense pressure during a lunch time rush is awesome.
The pizza steak is delicious. Full of source and provolone cheese. I would definitely come back !!
Terrible cheesesteaks just go to philly....

The experience is not a good one. There is a guy playing music through his speaker.  If you have other people in an establishment one would think people have home training but apparently not a thing. Then made a phone call like he's in his living room. If an establishment is scared to say turn it down or off maybe security is needed. Because it messes up the experience.
Food was good
The place was clean, the service was fast, the steak cheese was good ,I recommend Tony Luke.. I would definitely go back!
No flavor
The best Cheese Steak anywhere hands down....

This place give Philly Cheesesteaks a bad name. I was very disappointed. I had Cheesesteaks from Philly & they were nothing like this. I'm sorry to say but the Chinese restaurant down the block from me make Cheesesteaks hoagies way better than this place.

The place is great but it's not all that like they made it seem yes it's different at the one that they make over here in the bodegas but it's all right now the pizza steak my daughter had it and I tried it and it was awesome but the Philly cheesesteak I give it a 2
Not too many places in NY to get a great cheesesteak this is one of them
Nice workers, nice food
Delish
PLACE IS EHHHH ! I HAD A COUPLE BAD EXPERIENCES WITH THE SERVICE HERE, THE SCENE IS DECENT. I JUST FEEL SERVERS SHOULD BE MORE PATIENT WIT THEIR CUSTOMERS
Great sandwich
Kinda pricey but okay.
Delicious cheesesteak. Provolone is recommended.
Cheese Steak
Best cheesesteak i've ever had. My advice is add extra cheese whiz

So here's the deal. Like everyone else, I heard the hype about this place and given that my office had moved to Brooklyn a few months ago I thought it was meant to be. Went there for lunch the week it opened and the line was out the door. Despite this the service was relatively fast even if they have a disorganized ordering system. The sandwich was meh. I had a cheesesteak and the meat was good but the bread was soooooooooo chewy. By the time I was done I could win "world's strongest jaw" ,if there is such a thing because of the workout I got. My recommendation: fix the bread and the ordering system. Oh and it was expensive because... Brooklyn?

Wow these are some good cheese steaks. Perfectly cooked, good quality meat, amazing bread, and well balanced portions of ingredients in the sandwich. Not sure what other reviewers are complaining about. Staff was nice and the prices seem in line with the quality.
(Translated by Google) 9mmi  (Original) 9mmi

This store has more problems than a little bit. Today I had my mind set on getting one their great tasting Cheesesteak sandwiches. This the 2nd time I arrived to store was not opened as advertised on their door.At least the nice young lady. working there told me there were problems with their computers.  I know this Will be my last time coming to this Establishment for Food. Damn I paid for parking too..

Okay, I'm a newbie when it comes to Tony Luke's and hype about their opening in Brooklyn. While I have tried the Philly Cheese steak in Philly, I haven't had one in very long time. Passed by it and decided to try it. The ordering process easy enough. You got the steak chicken, pork or veggies. Add fries and sides as desired. Not sure if people don't know how to read as some people apparently can't from the reviews.  Additional toppings are $.99 and stated right on the menu. I certainly didn't expected it be free unless you are at Subway.  Service was ok. They took my order. I got my food. I would say it was a pretty good Cheese steak. I went with American, with jalapeno peppers and fries. Certainly, not an every day meal but good once in awhile.
They have good service good food  The prices is cheap for the location
Some of the friendliest service staff you’ll find in New York, and the food is pretty solid too!
Pretty good cheese steak
Excellent philly chicken steak and fries!!
Sooo Good! Not sure how the ones in Philadelphia taste...
Expensive
Cheesesteaks with onions and cheese wiz and roast pork with spinach and provolone. Both great.
It's the real deal. I'm from Philly, and these are real cheesesteaks. They've even got the roast pork !!  Delicious, fast, all good. I always get provolone, onions, and pickles. Weird I know.
Love this place its like going to philly in half the time. Gotta get the cheese whizz though.
Taste of Philly in NYC

I have been waiting for this place to open for so long. I wanted an authentic Philly steak sandwich from a place that I've heard so much about. I finally went the other day and placed my order for a sandwich. The manager asks you how you want the sandwich and encourages more items on the sandwich and when you're given the total you realize all of those sandwich items are extra and not free. So my $10 sandwich turned into $14 sandwich. I asked if he had jalapenos and he said yes they had cherry peppers and Italian peppers. I asked for jalapenos. He said Italian peppers were like jalapenos. I get if a business does not have something to accommodate the customer then you're supposed to at least offer a substitution but don't tell me you have jalapenos and you don't. It's not the same. But he claims it's spicy. I order both peppers and I wait almost 20 minutes for my sandwich. One person was in front of me with one sandwich and I had to wait that long for my sandwich. At this point I'm still assuming it was worth it. I finally get the sandwich and I have not eaten a thing all day so I know my taste buds are going to be a little biased because I haven't eaten so they're going to go crazy over this right? Wrong. The sandwich fell completely flat. The meat was tender and the bread was soft but that's pretty much all I can say about the sandwich that was positive. The peppers didn't do anything to the sandwich and that actually cost me more money. The meat tasted like it had been cooked in water that was seasoned with only black pepper. There was barely any flavor at all. The cheese and bread provided more flavor. I was extremely disappointed. I have been living in New York for over 10 years and the food here just sucks. It's like they are terrified of seasoning their food and I'm really tired of it. It's just not worth what I paid and if they didn't have the word of mouth reputation they had and didn't have the name Tony Luke's the business would definitely go under. I'm seriously upset I wasted that amount of money and waited that long for THAT sandwich. Highly disappointed. But hey, now I know. It's all hype.
Wish it was close to work. Eat everyday if it was lol

The staff here is very rude. I thought my first experience was going to be good. Monday was my first day. I go in and ask the hours for the day. One worker tells me 11pm. So I said oh ok thank you. Another worker tells me sarcastically said but you can come in at 10pm. Then Tuesday I went and ordered some mozzarella sticks. I got the bag and the  mozzarella sticks were thrown in the bag with no cardboard container. Just like how they did yesterday.
949 and told that they were on they were on their last customer. Not calling out their franchise, but how hard is it to melt cheese..
Got to get it wit provolone!
Worst wait time in history, plus they serve garbage......
Tasted just like I was back in philly.
Need a Philly from Philly to compare
Mediocre at best,  no comparison to the philly location. There's no consistency and sandwiches are extremely greasy!! Needs a little bit of quality control.
Horrible Horrible Horrible!! Dont taste nothing like the cheesesteaks in Philly. They're super small and have no taste at all. The chicken spots in Brooklyn cheesesteaks taste way better
Great but for the price the Italian bread. Should be bigger the bread is a little to small sandwich cost 10dollars over all 👌
Good was delicious.
Best Sandwich ever !!!
Best cheesesteak sandwich excellent chipotle fries I was so stuffed fell asleep on the ride home.Staff was very friendly.Will be there every weekend heard it’s open till midnight on weekends!!!!!

Poor imitation of the best cheese steak in Philly. The meat was fine, thin sliced and nicely grilled, though could be seasoned more. The rest of the sandwich was sorely  lacking. Bread was tough, possibly stale. Cheese distribution was all over the place, I had mild provolone and about a quarter of my sandwich was missing cheese altogether while the center was overflowing. For $10 and their Philly reputation, you would think they would put a little more care into the thing. It was also missing the hot pepper and pickle station, which really bummed me out. If you absolutely, positively NEED to try a  "Philly-style" cheese steak, by all means, but it's not worth a return visit.
I love the buffalo chicken all day
Sub-par sandwiches. Way too many people behind the food prep and grill area. The store itself needs to be larger

Nothing special about it especially for 12 $ for a basic what seems like roast beef and cheese. Only thing authentic is its greasy . They stuff that skinny flat meat from the freezer or fridge that u get from a corner deli and bang u for 12$..
Amazing food & staff
On 4/15/19 my wife and me tried Philly cheesesteak. It was horrible. Steak was processed like steak umm. Ask for xtra mayo and got mayo sandwich. Try jimbos its cheaper and get same sandwich
Steak um & bread. Edible but nothing spectacular. For $11 plus a extra dollar for lettuce and tomatoes.  I'd rather drive to Geno's. And I live in Queens NY.

My husband and I were very excited when we seen that Tony Luke’s was opening up in our area. So we finally decided to try it out. We order around $50.00 worth of food, for us and our kids. The “manager” was very unprofessional. Every time he called us up, there was another item missing. Never mind you our sandwiches were already done for the past 10 minutes sitting there getting cold. The final straw was when were called again, we check our items to see if everything is correct and we were still missing another item. When we tell the manager he still tries to push us out ignoring what we said! Finally I had enough. I asked for a refund of the missing item. We weren’t even able to enjoy our food due to it being extremely cold! Will I go back again? Maybe to the one in Philly! Brooklyn was one heck of an experience!
Same great sandwich you get in Philadelphia
I loved the staff. Very sweet and nice. I had a beef steak with wiz cheese very very yummy. Would definitely go back again
Had the beef cheesesteak hoagie with onions, American cheese, pickles, tomato and lettuce. Legit and not too bad but the beef could be more seasoned. Recommend to check it out!
Was here for breakfast sammy's. Staff were were very nice and friendly! Sandwiches were quite tasty and I'll definitely return. Coffee not bad as well.
Great food! But I was told by the Assistant manager that the manager was opening up peoples checks. I felt so bad for her.

Waste of time. Bland food, poor service.  I saw the opening for this spot on the news and made a special trip to downtown BK to experience the lauded Tony Luke's.  Unfortunately this was my first and last time there. After spending $15 for a sandwich and water and waiting in the tiny, overcrowded lines for 25 mins I was given a sandwich that was not what I ordered. I took a few bites then asked the counter staff if my order was correct. The meat was bland, the cheese was fine as was the bread.   Staff replied yes/no and offered a half-hearted apology but no new sandwich or any accommodations. She asked if I would eat it and I said no. She then ignored me to attend to a new customer.  I turned around and tossed the sandwich in the garbage and left. I hate wasting money and food, but this experience resulted in a loss of both. Avoid this place.

My first time having an authentic Philly Cheesesteak,   it was good, just wish the meat and broccoli  rabe was seasoned . It was a bit bland. The bread is really good.  Super fresh. I'd definitely give it another try, just have them add seasonings and some cherry peppers.
Clearly,  I don't get all of the hype. The bread was very good, however the meat was very bland. Honestly the cheesesteak from the bodega taste better.
Lines are crazy during lunch time. The bread was soft on the inside and crispy on the outside which was delicious, however the meat was bland. Nothing special to be honest.

This is definitely my new favorite fast food! I never liked Philly cheesesteak because deli’s didn’t make them well but after I gave this a shot, it changed everything! Absolutely recommend it. Can’t wait to visit again!

Very nice build out, small, efficient clean and organized!  The Beef cheesesteaks are good!! But No good on the chicken cheesesteaks. Dont recommend the chicken, as it doesnt taste like real chicken!  The chicken tasted and looks like flat sliced Tofu!
New spot that open up in Brooklyn definitely should check it out.

The cheesesteak sandwich is a bit small but tasty. The girl at the register (I was there Sat,4/6 approx 245pm) was super nice and engaging versus the usual angry, unhappy employees you run into in other stores around the city. I'd go back just because she was a professional.

Get your Philly hunch ready, authentic cheese steaks from south Philly have arrived. Straight forward, made to order. Nothing is photogenic or healthy but the flavor is there. And that’s why you’re here. Enjoy
Not bad. @ steak sandwich.   Excellent@ bar b q boneless chicken.
Very bland and overpriced

I'm Happy to find this DELICIOUS Philly cheese steak with the fried onions, cheese wiz & spicy cherry peppers. Went one time, and I'm dreaming about my next trip from Queens... I'm already addicted!!!
Love this spot !!! Best cheesesteak in NYC
EVERYONE NEEDS TO TRY TONY LUKES !!! Fresh and delicious i almost ate my hands 😂 i was vegan til i had a cheesesteak today 🤠👍🏾
They messed up my order but it’s their first day. The food isn’t that great tho. I was warned but didn’t listen. Wouldn’t feed these cheesesteaks to my worst enemy.

I was very disappointed but willing to give it another shot as service was solid and the employees were busting their butts. I’m hoping they get it together and work out the kinks. The line was pretty long as it seemed every cheesesteak loving Brooklynite was eagerly awaiting the opening - 30 minutes wait to place an order and an additional 15-20 to get the goods. I had the beef cheesesteak with fried onions, provolone and pickles. The sandwich was pretty disappointing being bland, dry and my cheese was on one corner of my sandwich. Hopefully in a few weeks I can be a satisfied customer.
I’m so excited the franchise is finally here in NYC 🥳 BEST CHEESESTEAK 🌯
WHAT!!! TONY LUKE’S. That’s what I’m talking about.
